{"step_by_step_thinking": "The force required to tip a tooth is a measure of the amount of pressure needed to move a tooth within the alveolar bone. This is a delicate process and requires a precise amount of force. Too much force can damage the tooth and surrounding tissues, while too little force will not move the tooth. The appropriate force required to tip a tooth is generally accepted to be between 35 - 60mg.", "answer_choice": "B"}
